short_description: Performs histogram calculation on a data set
long_description: Enhanced histogram calculation on a data set, which accepts bin breaks or bin <start,end> as input or determines them auto, output <bin number,bin_start, bin_end, bin_count, bin_percent>.

input_tables.name: InputTable
input_tables.rDescription: The table containing the input data.
input_tables.description: The table containing the input data.

input_tables.name: CustomBinTable
input_tables.rDescription: A table containing the boundary points between bins. If this argument is present, custom.bin.column must also be present. auto.bin, start.value, bin.size, and end.value cannot be present.
input_tables.description: A table containing the boundary points between bins. If this argument is present, CustomBinColumn must also be present. AutoBin, StartValue, BinSize, and EndValue cannot be present.

output_tables.name: OutputTable
output_tables.rDescription: Name for the table that the function will generate, containing the output.
output_tables.description: Name for the table that the function will generate, containing the output.

argument_clauses.name: TargetColumn
argument_clauses.rDescription: The column in the input table for which statistics will be computed. Column must contain a numeric SQL types (integer, bigint, real, double precision, numeric, decimal, smallint).
argument_clauses.description: The column in the input table for which statistics will be computed. Column must contain a numeric SQL types (integer, bigint, real, double precision, numeric, decimal, smallint).

argument_clauses.name: CustomBinColumn
argument_clauses.rDescription: The column in the custom.bin.table containing the boundary values. Input columns must contain numeric SQL types. If this argument is present, custom.bin.table must also be present. auto.bin, start.value, bin.size, and end.value cannot be present.
argument_clauses.description: The column in the CustomBinTable containing the boundary values. Input columns must contain numeric SQL types. If this argument is present, CustomBinTable must also be present. AutoBin, StartValue, BinSize, and EndValue cannot be present.

argument_clauses.name: GroupbyColumns
argument_clauses.rDescription: Columns in the input table used to group values for binning. These columns cannot contain doubles or floats.
argument_clauses.description: Columns in the input table used to group values for binning. These columns cannot contain doubles or floats.

argument_clauses.name: Inclusion
argument_clauses.rDescription: Indicates whether points on bin boundaries should be included in the bin on the left or the bin on the right. The permitted values are [left, right]. The default value is left.
argument_clauses.description: Indicates whether points on bin boundaries should be included in the bin on the left or the bin on the right. The permitted values are [left, right]. The default value is left.

argument_clauses.name: AutoBin
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies either the algorithm to be used for selecting bin boundaries or the approximate number of bins to be found. The permitted values are STURGES, SCOTT, or a positive integer. If this argument is present, custom.bin.table, custom.bin.column, start.value, bin.size, and end.value cannot be present.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies either the algorithm to be used for selecting bin boundaries or the approximate number of bins to be found. The permitted values are STURGES, SCOTT, or a positive integer. If this argument is present, CustomBinTable, CustomBinColumn, StartValue, BinSize, and EndValue cannot be present.

argument_clauses.name: StartValue
argument_clauses.rDescription: The smallest value to be used in binning. If this argument is present, bin.size and en.value must also be present. auto.bin, custom.bin.table and custom.bin.column cannot be present.
argument_clauses.description: The smallest value to be used in binning. If this argument is present, BinSize and EndValue must also be present. AutoBin, CustomBinTable and CustomBinColumn cannot be present.

argument_clauses.name: EndValue
argument_clauses.rDescription: The largest value to be used in binning. If this argument is present, start.value and bin.size must also be present. auto.bin, custom.bin.table and custom.bin.column cannot be present.
argument_clauses.description: The largest value to be used in binning. If this argument is present, StartValue and BinSize must also be present. AutoBin, CustomBinTable and CustomBinColumn cannot be present.

argument_clauses.name: BinSize
argument_clauses.rDescription: For equally sized bins, a double value specifying the width of the bin. Omit this argument if you are not using equally sized bins. The input value must be greater than 0.0. If this argument is present, start.value and end.value must also be present. auto.bin, custom.bin.table and custom.bin.column cannot be present.
argument_clauses.description: For equally sized bins, a double value specifying the width of the bin. Omit this argument if you are not using equally sized bins. The input value must be greater than 0.0. If this argument is present, StartValue and EndValue must also be present. AutoBin, CustomBinTable and CustomBinColumn cannot be present.

argument_clauses.name: SequenceInputBy
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the LIST_VECTOR of column(s) that uniquely identifies each row of the input argument INPUT_ARG_NAME. The argument is used to ensure deterministic results for functions which produce results that vary from run to run.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the input column(s) that uniquely identify each row of input table. The format is 'input1:c1' where input1 refers to the alias used by the input table that contains such column named c1.
